tit.cmt: Theを削除しました。(a clay figure)を追加しました。

sen.j: 埴輪（はにわ）とは、日本の古墳時代に特有の素焼の焼き物。
sen.e: The Haniwa are unglazed pottery characteristic of Japanese tumulus period.
The Haniwa are unglazed pottery characteristic of the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.
sen.cmt: of Japanese tumulus period→the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japanに修正しました。文章の終わりにある余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: The Haniwa are unglazed pottery characteristic of the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.

sen.j: 古墳上に並べ立てられた。
sen.e: They were lined up on the tumulus.
They were set on top of the tumulus.
sen.cmt: 全文見直しました。修正しています。
sen.e: They were set on top of the tumulus.

sen.j: 日本各地の古墳に分布している。
sen.e: Various tumulus around the country have them.
Haniwa are distributed all over the tumulus in Japan.
sen.cmt: 全文見直しました。修正しています。
sen.e: Haniwa are distributed all over the tumulus in Japan.

sen.j: 埴輪は、3世紀後半から6世紀後半にかけて造られ、前方後円墳とともに消滅した。
sen.e: The Haniwa were made between the late third century and the late sixth century, disappearing along with the large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds.
Haniwa were made between the late third to the late sixth century, and they disappeared along with the large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds.
sen.cmt: The削除しました。centuryを削除し、andをtoに修正しました。disappearing→they disappearedに修正しました。
sen.e: Haniwa were made between the late third to the late sixth century, and they disappeared along with the large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds.

sen.j: 基本的に中空である。
sen.e: Basically they are hollow.
Basically Haniwa's body is hollow.
sen.cmt: 英文だけでは意味解釈が難しかったので、Haniwa's bodyの部分を追加しています。
sen.e: Basically Haniwa's body is hollow.

sen.j: 造り方は粘土で紐を作り、それを積み上げていきながら形を整えた。
sen.e: They were made by piling up strings made of clay and building up them neatly.
They were made by piling up strings with clay and building up them neatly.
sen.cmt: made of clay→with clayに修正しました。
sen.e: They were made by piling up strings with clay and building up them neatly.

sen.j: 時には、別に焼いたものを組み合わせたりしている。
sen.e: Sometimes they were made by combining the parts which had been burned separately.
Sometimes they were made by combining the parts which had been burned separately.
sen.cmt: 文章終わりに余分なスペースがあり、削除しました。
sen.e: Sometimes they were made by combining the parts which had been burned separately.

sen.j: また、いろいろな埴輪の骨格を先に作っておき、それに粘土を貼り付けるなどした。
sen.e: And various frames of the Haniwa had been made previously and clay was applied on it.
And various frames of the Haniwa had been made previously and clay was applied on it.
And various frames of the Haniwa had been made previously and clay was applied on it.

sen.j: 型を用いて作ったものはない。
sen.e: Molds were not used.
Molds were not used.
Molds were not used.

sen.j: 中心的な埴輪には、表面にベンガラなどの赤色染料を塗布した。
sen.e: The Haniwa which was important was applied dyes of red such as colcothar on its surface.
Some of main Haniwa were applied red dyes such as colcothar on its surface.
Some of main Haniwa were applied red dyes such as colcothar on its surface.

sen.j: 畿内では赤以外の色はほとんど用いられなかったが、関東地方では、形象埴輪にいろいろな彩色が施されている。
sen.e: No color other than red was used in Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), however, various color were applied on the keisho haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast) in Kanto region.

No colors other than red were used in Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), however, various colors were applied on the Keisho Haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast) in Kanto region.
sen.cmt: color,was→複数形に修正しました。various color→複数形に修正しました。keisho haniwa→大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: No colors other than red were used in Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), however, various colors were applied on the Keisho Haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast) in Kanto region.

sen.j: 埴輪は、古墳の憤丘や造り出しなどに立て並べられた。
sen.e: The Haniwa were displayed standing on the hill or narrow terrace of tumulus.
The Haniwa were set on the hill or the funeral ritual site of the tumulus.
sen.cmt: 全文見直しています。「造り出し」について訳者はnarrow terraceと訳出していますが、「造り出し」とは祭祀場と考えられる場所であるようで、誤訳です。
sen.e: The Haniwa were set on the hill or the funeral ritual site of the tumulus.

sen.j: 埴輪は、大きく円筒埴輪と形象埴輪の2種類に区分される。
sen.e: The Haniwa were broadly classified into two types; ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa) and keisho haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast).
The Haniwa were broadly classified into two types, cylindrical Haniwa and Keisho Haniwa.
sen.cmt: Ento Haniwa→英文での理解を促すため、後列にてEnto Haniwaとcylindrical Haniwaが混在していることから、円筒埴輪＝cylindrical Haniwaに修正しました。以降も同じです。keisho haniwa→大文字に修正しました。;→コンマに変更しました。(clay figure in the shape of human or beast)は上記に既出訳なので、削除しました。
sen.e: The Haniwa were broadly classified into two types, cylindrical Haniwa and Keisho Haniwa.

sen.j: さらに、形象埴輪を大きく分けると家形埴輪、器財埴輪、動物埴輪、人物埴輪の四種がある。
sen.e: And there are roughly four kinds of keisho haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast); kakei haniwa (house-shaped clay figure), kizai haniwa (clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield), animal-shaped haniwa and a haniwa figure of a man.
And there were roughly four kinds of Keisho Haniwa; house-shaped Haniwa, Kizai Haniwa (clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield), animal-shaped Haniwa, and Haniwa figure of men.
sen.cmt: are過去形に修正しました。Kakei Haniwa→英文として理解しやすいように、house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。以降同様です。keisho haniwa, kizai haniwa→大文字に修正しました。(clay figure in the shape of human or beast)→削除しました。animal-shaped Haniwaの後にコンマを追加しました。a man→menに修正しました。
sen.e: And there were roughly four kinds of Keisho Haniwa; house-shaped Haniwa, Kizai Haniwa (clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield), animal-shaped Haniwa, and Haniwa figure of men.

sen.j: 埴輪からは、古墳時代当時の衣服・髪型・武具・農具・建築様式などの復元が可能であり、貴重な史料でもある。
sen.e: Haniwa were important as historical materials because the clothing, hairstyle, arms, farming tools, and architecture of Tumulus period can be recreated from them.
Haniwa were important as historical materials because the clothing, hairstyles, arms, farming tools, and architectures during the Tumulus period can be recreated from them.
sen.cmt: hairstyle, architecture→複数形に修正しました。of Tumulus period→during the Tumulus periodに修正しました。
sen.e: Haniwa were important as historical materials because the clothing, hairstyles, arms, farming tools, and architectures during the Tumulus period can be recreated from them.

sen.j: 埴輪の起源は、弥生時代後期後葉の吉備地方の首長のお墓であると考えられている弥生墳丘墓（例えば、楯築遺跡）から出土する特殊器台・特殊壺（特殊器台型土器・特殊壺型土器とも呼称される）であるといわれている。
sen.e: The origin of the Haniwa are thought to be tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) and tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar) (they are also called tokushu-kidaigata doki and tokushu tsubo gata doki respectively) unearthed from Yayoi grave mound (Tatetsuki Tumulus for example), which was likely to be the grave of a chief of Kibi region in the late latter part of the Yayoi Period.

The origin of the Haniwa is thought to be Tokushu-Kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) and Tokushu Tsubo (ceremonial jar) (they are also called Tokushu-Kidaigata Doki and Tokushu Tsubo Gata Doki respectively) unearthed from Yayoi grave mound (Tatetsuki Tumulus for example), which was likely to be the grave of a chief of Kibi region in the latter part of the late Yayoi Period.
sen.cmt: Haniwa are thought→文法ミスです。isに修正しました。tokushu-kidai, tokushu tsubo→大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: The origin of the Haniwa is thought to be Tokushu-Kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) and Tokushu Tsubo (ceremonial jar) (they are also called Tokushu-Kidaigata Doki and Tokushu Tsubo Gata Doki respectively) unearthed from Yayoi grave mound (Tatetsuki Tumulus for example), which was likely to be the grave of a chief of Kibi region in the latter part of the late Yayoi Period.

sen.j: 3世紀中葉〜後葉になると、前方後円墳（岡山市都月坂1号墳、桜井市箸墓古墳、兵庫県たつの市御津町権現山51号憤）から最古の円筒埴輪である都月型円筒埴輪が出土している。
sen.e: The Totsuki-style cylindrical hahiwa (clay figure), which are the oldest ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa), of between about the middle and the late of the 3rd century were unearthed from large keyhole-shaped tomb mound (Okayama City Totsukizaka Ichigo-kofun Tumulus, Sakurai City Hashihaka tomb and Tatsuno City, Hyogo Prefecture Mitsu City Mt.Gongen Gojuichigo-kofun Tumulus).

From the middle to the late of the third century, the Totsuki-style cylindrical Haniwa, which are the oldest cylindrical Haniwa, were unearthed from large keyhole-shaped tomb mound (Totsukizaka Ichigo-kofun Tumulus in Okayama City, Hashihaka tomb in Sakurai City, and Mt.Gongen Gojuichigo-kofun Tumulus in Mitsu-cho, Tatsuno City, Hyogo Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 同じ訳文の中に同じ語をさす言葉が違う言葉で表現されています。cylindrical hahiwaと ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa)→一つに統一しています。Haniwaについての説明(clay figure)はもうここでは不要です。削除しました。hahiwa→スペルミスです。修正しました。大文字に修正しました。3rd→スペルアウトしました。語順を変更しました。（）内の地名の語順を修正しました。Mitsu City(御津町)は間違いです。修正しました。
sen.e: From the middle to the late of the third century, the Totsuki-style cylindrical Haniwa, which are the oldest cylindrical Haniwa, were unearthed from large keyhole-shaped tomb mound (Totsukizaka Ichigo-kofun Tumulus in Okayama City, Hashihaka tomb in Sakurai City, and Mt.Gongen Gojuichigo-kofun Tumulus in Mitsu-cho, Tatsuno City, Hyogo Prefecture).

sen.j: この埴輪の分布は備中から近江までに及んでいる。
sen.e: The distribution range of those Haniwa stretches from Bicchu (the western part of Okayama Prefecture) to Omi Province.
Those Haniwa were distributed from Bicchu (the western part of Okayama Prefecture) to Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 文の最後に余分なスペースがあるので削除しました。全文修正しました。
sen.e: Those Haniwa were distributed from Bicchu (the western part of Okayama Prefecture) to Omi Province.

sen.j: このことから、埴輪の成立地を吉備に限るという見解は改められるかも知れない。
sen.e: Which might alter the theory that the Haniwa was established only in Kibi.
This distribution may revise the opinion that the Haniwa originated only from Kibi.
sen.cmt: 誤訳です。全文修正しました。
sen.e: This distribution may revise the opinion that the Haniwa originated only from Kibi.

sen.j: ところで、最古の埴輪である都月形円筒埴輪と最古の前方後円墳の副葬品とされる大陸製の三角縁神獣鏡とが、同じ墓から出土しないで、前者が出ると後者が出ないし、その反対もあることが知られていた。
sen.e: By the way, it was known that Totsuki-style cylindrical Haniwa, which are the oldest Haniwa, and Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror made in continent, which are thought to be the oldest burial goods of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound, were not found in the same tomb, that is, when the former were unearthed from a tomb, the latter were not found there, and vice versa.

By the way, it was known that Totsuki-style cylindrical Haniwa, which are the oldest Haniwa, and Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror (triangular-rimmed mirror) made in continent, which are thought to be the oldest burial goods of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound, were not found in the same tomb, that is, when the former were unearthed from a tomb, the latter were not found there, and vice versa.
sen.cmt: 英文としてSankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrorだけでは理解できません。(triangular-rimmed mirror)を追加しました。
sen.e: By the way, it was known that Totsuki-style cylindrical Haniwa, which are the oldest Haniwa, and Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror (triangular-rimmed mirror) made in continent, which are thought to be the oldest burial goods of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound, were not found in the same tomb, that is, when the former were unearthed from a tomb, the latter were not found there, and vice versa.

sen.j: しかし、兵庫県たつの市御津町の前方後円墳権現山51号墳の後方部の石槨から三角縁神獣鏡が5面発見され、石槨すぐそばで都月型円筒埴輪が発見された。
sen.e: However, five Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered from Mt.Gongen Gojuichigo-kofun Tumulus, Mitsu-cho, Tatsuno City, Hyogo Prefecture and Totsuki-style cylindrical Hahiwa nearby Ishiki (a room made of stone in the tomb, in which coffins were placed).

However, five Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered from at the back of Ishiki (a room made of stone in the tomb, in which coffins were placed) of Mt.Gongen Gojuichigo-kofun Tumulus, Mitsu-cho, Tatsuno City, Hyogo Prefecture, and Totsuki-style cylindrical Haniwa was discovered from beside Ishiki.
sen.cmt: 「の後方部の石槨から」の部分が訳漏れです。訳出しています。was discovered from追加しました。Hahiwa→スペルミスです。Prefecture後にコンマ追加しました。nearby→besideに修正しました。
sen.e: However, five Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered from at the back of Ishiki (a room made of stone in the tomb, in which coffins were placed) of Mt.Gongen Gojuichigo-kofun Tumulus, Mitsu-cho, Tatsuno City, Hyogo Prefecture, and Totsuki-style cylindrical Haniwa was discovered from beside Ishiki.

sen.j: 現在はこの一例だけである。
sen.e: That is the only example so far.
That is the only example so far.
That is the only example so far.

sen.j: なお、前方後円墳の出現は、ヤマト王権の成立を表すと考えられており、前方後円墳に宮山型の特殊器台・特殊壺が採用されていることは、吉備地方の首長がヤマト王権の成立に深く参画したことの現れだとされている。
sen.e: The appearance of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound is thought to be representing the establishment of Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) and adopting Miyayama type tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) and tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar) in large keyhole-shaped tomb mound shows that a chief of Kibi region deeply involved in the establishment of Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty).

The appearance of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound is thought to be representing the establishment of Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) and adopting Miyayama type of ceremonial vessel stand and ceremonial jar in large keyhole-shaped tomb mound showed that a chief of Kibi region deeply involved in the establishment of Yamato sovereignty.
sen.cmt: 文の最後に余分なスペースがあるので削除しました。tokushu-kidai, tokushu tsubo大文字に修正しました。tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand)、tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar)→英文として理解が難しく、上段に出てきたように日本語の音表記で残す必要もあまり感じられないので、「特殊器台」＝ceremonial vessel stand、「特殊壺」＝ceremonial jarと以降します。(the ancient Japan sovereignty)２回登場するので、一つ削除しました。shows→過去形に修正しました。
sen.e: The appearance of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound is thought to be representing the establishment of Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) and adopting Miyayama type of ceremonial vessel stand and ceremonial jar in large keyhole-shaped tomb mound showed that a chief of Kibi region deeply involved in the establishment of Yamato sovereignty.

sen.j: 吉備勢力の東遷説もある。
sen.e: There is a theory saying Kibi power moved east.
There is a theory that Kibi power moved to east.
sen.cmt: saying→thatに修正しました。movedの後にtoを追加しました。
sen.e: There is a theory that Kibi power moved to east.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』垂仁紀には、野見宿禰（のみのすくね）が日葉酢媛命の陵墓へ殉死者を埋める代わりに土で作った人馬を立てることを提案したとあり、これを埴輪の起源とする。
sen.e: According to Era of Emperor Suinin in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), NOMI no Sukune suggested displaying human and horses made of earth instead of burying dead people who followed their lord to the grave in an imperial mausoleum of Hibasu hime, which is defined as the origin of the Haniwa.

According to the book of Emperor Suinin in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), NOMI no Sukune suggested the Emperor to take clay and form the shapes of men and horses instead of burying dead people who followed their lord to the grave in an imperial mausoleum of Princess Hibasu, which was defined as the origin of the Haniwa.
sen.cmt: 垂仁紀→ここでの紀とは、「垂仁天皇を記した紀（文書）」という意味です。修正しました。in "Nihonshoki"のスペースを削除しました。displaying human and horses made of earth →変更しました。human→menに修正しました。Hibasu hime→Princess Hibasuに変更しました。
sen.e: According to the book of Emperor Suinin in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), NOMI no Sukune suggested the Emperor to take clay and form the shapes of men and horses instead of burying dead people who followed their lord to the grave in an imperial mausoleum of Princess Hibasu, which was defined as the origin of the Haniwa.

sen.j: しかし、考古学的に上記のような変遷過程が明らかとなっており、この説話は否定されている。
sen.e: However, that story is denied as the changing process mentioned above is known archaeologically.
However, that story is denied as the changing process mentioned above was known archaeologically.
sen.cmt: is過去形に修正しました。
sen.e: However, that story is denied as the changing process mentioned above was known archaeologically.

sen.j: 古墳時代前期初頭（3世紀中葉〜後葉）には、円筒形または壺形、少し遅れて器台の上の壺を乗せた形の朝顔形埴輪などの円筒埴輪が見られた。
sen.e: In the early Tumulus period (from about the middle to the late part of the 3 rd century), ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa) such as cylindrical form haniwa or jar form haniwa, and later, bell-shaped haniwa which have the form putting a jar on the stand appeared.

In the early Tumulus period (from about the middle to the late part of the third century), cylindrical Haniwa appeared such as cylindrical form Haniwa, or jar form Haniwa, and later, bell-shaped Haniwa which had the form putting a jar on the stand.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。ento haniwa→cylindrical Haniwaに修正しました。haniwa全て大文字に修正しました。主語と動詞が離れすぎて文章が分かりにくいです。修正しました。have過去形に修正しました。
sen.e: In the early Tumulus period (from about the middle to the late part of the third century), cylindrical Haniwa appeared such as cylindrical form Haniwa, or jar form Haniwa, and later, bell-shaped Haniwa which had the form putting a jar on the stand.

sen.j: これら筒形埴輪は、地面に置くだけではなく、脚部を掘った穴に埋めるものへと変化した。
sen.e: These cylindrical haniwa displayed not only placing on the ground but also changing to bury their leg part into the hole dug into the ground.
These cylindrical Haniwa had been changed not only placing on the ground but also burying their leg parts into the hole dug into the ground.
sen.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました。Not only~but alsoに誤訳があります。修正しました。leg part→複数形に修正しました。
sen.e: These cylindrical Haniwa had been changed not only placing on the ground but also burying their leg parts into the hole dug into the ground.

sen.j: 前方後円墳の広がりとともに全国に広がった。
sen.e: They spread around the country as large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds did.
They spread around the country as large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds did.
They spread around the country as large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds did.

sen.j: 前期前葉（4世紀前葉）には、これらの埴輪とは別の系統に当たる家形埴輪のほか、蓋（きぬがさ）形埴輪や盾形埴輪をはじめとする器財埴輪、鶏形埴輪などの形象埴輪が現れた。
sen.e: Early of the early part of Tumulus period (early part of the 4th century), kakei haniwa (house-shaped clay figure), which are different type from those haniwa, kizai haniwa (clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield) including lid-shaped haniwa and peltate haniwa and keisho haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast) such as chicken-shaped haniwa appeared.

In the early of the fourth century, house-shaped Haniwa, which are different type from those Haniwa, Kizai Haniwa including lid-shaped Haniwa and peltate Haniwa and Keisho Haniwa such as chicken-shaped Haniwa appeared.
sen.cmt: 前期前葉（4世紀前葉）とありますが、実際の年代は（4世紀前葉）箇所なので、この箇所だけを訳出することで、理解可能だと思われます。数字スペルアウトしました。Kakei Haniwa→house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。kizai haniwa, keisho haniwa全て大文字に修正しました。(clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield), (clay figure in the shape of human or beast)全て既出なので削除しました。haniwa全て大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: In the early of the fourth century, house-shaped Haniwa, which are different type from those Haniwa, Kizai Haniwa including lid-shaped Haniwa and peltate Haniwa and Keisho Haniwa such as chicken-shaped Haniwa appeared.

sen.j: 初現期の形象埴輪については、どのような構成でどの場所に建てられたか未だ不明な点が多い。
sen.e: About the early keisho haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast), it is not clear what construction they had and where they were put.
About the early Keisho Haniwa, it is not clear what structure they had and where they were put.
sen.cmt: keisho haniwa大文字に修正しました。(clay figure in the shape of human or beast)既出なので削除しました。ここでの「構成」はconstructionは不適切です。
sen.e: About the early Keisho Haniwa, it is not clear what structure they had and where they were put.

sen.j: その後、墳頂中央で家型埴輪の周りに盾形・蓋形などの器財埴輪で取り巻き、さらに円筒埴輪で取り巻くという豪華な配置の定式化が4世紀後半の早い段階で成立する。
sen.e: After that, the formularization of the sumptuous alignment, displaying kizai haniwa (clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield) such as lid-shaped haniwa and peltate haniwa around kakei haniwa (house-shaped clay figure) on the center of the mound top, and ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa) around them was established in the early stage of the late 4th century.

After that, the formularization of the sumptuous arrangement was established in the early stage of the late fourth century, which was displaying Kizai Haniwa such as lid-shaped Haniwa and peltate Haniwa around house-shaped Haniwa on the center of the mound top, and cylindrical Haniwa around them.
sen.cmt: 文の最後に余分なスペースがあるので削除しました。alignmentここでの配置の意味には不適切です。修正しました。数字をスペルアウトしました。Kakei Haniwa→house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。kizai haniwa大文字に修正しました。(clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield)既出なので削除しました。ento haniwa→cylindrical Haniwaに修正しました。haniwa全て大文字に修正しました。主語と動詞が分かりにくかったので、語順を修正しました。
sen.e: After that, the formularization of the sumptuous arrangement was established in the early stage of the late fourth century, which was displaying Kizai Haniwa such as lid-shaped Haniwa and peltate Haniwa around house-shaped Haniwa on the center of the mound top, and cylindrical Haniwa around them.

sen.j: そこに用いられた円筒埴輪は胴部の左右に鰭を貼り付け鰭付き円筒埴輪である。
sen.e: The ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa) used there were ento haniwa with fins to which fins are attached on the both sides of body parts.
The cylindrical Haniwa used there were with fins, which are attached on the both sides of body parts.
sen.cmt: ento haniwa→cylindrical Haniwaに修正しました。二つ目のento haniwa削除しました。二つ目のfins削除しました。
sen.e: The cylindrical Haniwa used there were with fins, which are attached on the both sides of body parts.

sen.j: さらに、古墳時代中期中葉（5世紀中ごろ）からは、巫女などの人物埴輪やウマや犬などの動物埴輪が登場した。
sen.e: And from about the middle of the middle Tumulus period, haniwa figure of a man such as priestess and animal-shaped haniwa such as horse-shaped and dog-shaped haniwa appeared.
In the middle of Tumulus period (the middle of fifth century), Haniwa figure of men such as priestess, and animal-shaped Haniwa such as horse-shaped, and dog-shaped appeared.
sen.cmt: （5世紀中ごろ）訳漏れです。追加しました。a man→men に修正しました。最後のhaniwa削除しました。
sen.e: In the middle of Tumulus period (the middle of fifth century), Haniwa figure of men such as priestess, and animal-shaped Haniwa such as horse-shaped, and dog-shaped appeared.

sen.j: またこの頃から、埴輪の配列の仕方に変化が現れた。
sen.e: Around that time, the alignment of haniwa began to change.
Around that time, the arrangement of Haniwa began to change.
sen.cmt: alignmentここでの配置の意味には不適切です。修正しました。haniwa大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: Around that time, the arrangement of Haniwa began to change.

sen.j: それは、器財埴輪や家形埴輪が外側で方形を形作るように配列されるようになった。
sen.e: Kizai haniwa (clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield) and kakei haniwa (house-shaped clay figure) began to be aligned to shape a square in the external part.
Kizai Haniwa and house-shaped Haniwa began to be arranged to shape a square in the surrounding of the tumulus.
sen.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました。Kakei Haniwa→ house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。(clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield)既出なので削除しました。alignedここでの配置の意味には不適切です。修正しました。ここでの「外側」というのは古墳の外と考えるのが自然だと思います。
sen.e: Kizai Haniwa and house-shaped Haniwa began to be arranged to shape a square in the surrounding of the tumulus.

sen.j: あるいは、方形列を省略することも行われている。
sen.e: Or omitting the square shape was also occurred.
Or omitting the square shape was also occurred.
Or omitting the square shape was also occurred.

sen.j: さらに、靭形埴輪の鰭過度に飾り立ててるようになったり、家型埴輪の屋根部分が不釣り合いに大型化したりするようになる。
sen.e: And sheath-shaped haniwa began to be decked with too many fins and the roofs of the kakei haniwa (house-shaped clay figure) were becoming overproportionate.
And sheath-shaped Haniwa began to be decked with too many fins and the roofs of the house-shaped Haniwa became overproportionate.
sen.cmt: Kakei Haniwa→house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。were becoming→becameに修正しました。
sen.e: And sheath-shaped Haniwa began to be decked with too many fins and the roofs of the house-shaped Haniwa became overproportionate.

sen.j: 畿内では古墳時代後期（6世紀中ごろ）に前方後円墳が衰退するとともに、埴輪も次第に姿を消していったが、なおも前方後円墳を盛んに築造した関東地方においては埴輪も引き続き盛んに作られ続けた。
sen.e: In Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) the haniwa were disappearing as large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds declined in the late Tumulus period (around the middle of the 6th century), however, in Kanto region, where large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds were built vigorously, the haniwa still continued to be made.

In Kinai region, the Haniwa were disappeared as large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds declined in the late Tumulus period (around the middle of the sixth century), however, in Kanto region, where large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds were built vigorously, the Haniwa still continued to be made.
sen.cmt: (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto)既出です、削除しました。disappearing→disappearedに修正しました。数字スペルアウトしました。haniwa大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: In Kinai region, the Haniwa were disappeared as large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds declined in the late Tumulus period (around the middle of the sixth century), however, in Kanto region, where large keyhole-shaped tomb mounds were built vigorously, the Haniwa still continued to be made.

sen.j: 元々、吉備地方に発生した特殊器台形土器・特殊壺形土器は、墳墓上で行われた葬送儀礼に用いられものであるが、古墳に継承された円筒埴輪は、墳丘や重要な区画を囲い込むというその樹立方法からして、聖域を区画するという役割を有していたと考えられる。
sen.e: Originally, Tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) form earthenware and tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar) form earthenware started in Kibi region were used in funeral rituals, while ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa) passed on tumulus are thought to have had a purpose to divide the sanctuary based on their alignment of surrounding a hill tomb and important section.

Originally, ceremonial vessel stand form earthenware and ceremonial jar form earthenware started in Kibi region were used in funeral rituals, while cylindrical Haniwa passed on tumulus are thought to have had a purpose to divide the sanctuary based on their arrangement of surrounding a hill tomb and important section.
sen.cmt: ento haniwa→cylindrical Haniwaに修正しました。alignment→arrangementに修正しました。tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand)、tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar)→ceremonial vessel stand、ceremonial jarに修正しました。
sen.e: Originally, ceremonial vessel stand form earthenware and ceremonial jar form earthenware started in Kibi region were used in funeral rituals, while cylindrical Haniwa passed on tumulus are thought to have had a purpose to divide the sanctuary based on their arrangement of surrounding a hill tomb and important section.

sen.j: 家形埴輪については、死者の霊が生活するための依代（よりしろ）という説と死者が生前に居住していた居館を表したものという説がある。
sen.e: About kakei haniwa (house-shaped clay figure), one theory has it that they were yorishiro (object representative of a divine spirit) where the souls of the deceased lived and the other theory they were representations of the residences the deceased lived before death.

About house-shaped Haniwa, there are two theories; one theory that they were Yorishiro (object representative of a divine spirit) where the souls of the deceased lived and the other theory that they were representations of the residences the deceased lived before death.
sen.cmt: Kakei Haniwa→house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。there are two theories; を追加しました。has itを削除しました。
sen.e: About house-shaped Haniwa, there are two theories; one theory that they were Yorishiro (object representative of a divine spirit) where the souls of the deceased lived and the other theory that they were representations of the residences the deceased lived before death.

sen.j: 古墳の埋葬施設の真上やその周辺の墳丘上に置かれる例が多い。
sen.e: They were usually displayed right above the burial facilities or on a hill tomb around it.
They were usually displayed right above the burial facilities or on a hill tomb around it.
They were usually displayed right above the burial facilities or on a hill tomb around it.

sen.j: 器財埴輪では、蓋が高貴な身分を表象するものであることから、蓋形埴輪も同様な役割と考えられているほか、盾や甲冑などの武具や武器形のものは、その防御や攻撃といった役割から、悪霊や災いの侵入を防ぐ役割を持っていると考えられている。
sen.e: About Kizai Haniwa, lid-shaped Haniwa are thought to have represented high class lineage, because the lid was the symbol of that, and Haniwa shaped like weapons or arms such as shields and armors, are thought to have placed to prevent invasion of an evil spirit or calamity, because of their acrual purpose of defending or attacking.

About Kizai Haniwa, lid-shaped Haniwa are thought to have represented high class lineage, because the lid was the symbol of that, and Haniwa shaped like weapons or arms such as shields and armors, are thought to have placed to prevent invasion of an evil spirit or calamity, because of their acrual purpose of defending or attacking.

About Kizai Haniwa, lid-shaped Haniwa are thought to have represented high class lineage, because the lid was the symbol of that, and Haniwa shaped like weapons or arms such as shields and armors, are thought to have placed to prevent invasion of an evil spirit or calamity, because of their acrual purpose of defending or attacking.

sen.j: 人物埴輪や動物埴輪などは、行列や群像で並べられており、葬送儀礼を表現したとする説、生前の祭政の様子を再現したとする説などが唱えられている。
sen.e: The haniwa figure of a man and animal-shaped haniwa were displayed as a line or a group of statues, therefore there are theories such as that they represented funeral rites and that they recreated the political rituals before death.

The Haniwa figure of men and animal-shaped Haniwa were displayed as a line or a group of statues, therefore there are theories such as that they represented funeral rites and that they recreated the political rituals before death.
sen.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました。a man→menに修正しました。
sen.e: The Haniwa figure of men and animal-shaped Haniwa were displayed as a line or a group of statues, therefore there are theories such as that they represented funeral rites and that they recreated the political rituals before death.

sen.j: このような埴輪の変遷は、古墳時代の祭祀観・死生観を反映しているとする見方もある。
sen.e: It is thought such change of haniwa might reflect the view of a religious service and that of life and death in Tumulus period.
It is thought such change of Haniwa might reflect the view of a religious service and that of life and death in Tumulus period.
sen.cmt: 文の最後に余分なスペースがあるので削除しました。haniwa大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: It is thought such change of Haniwa might reflect the view of a religious service and that of life and death in Tumulus period.

tit.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました。
Ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa)→cylindrical Haniwaに修正しました。

sen.j: 吉備地方の首長の埋葬儀礼に使われた特殊器台・特殊壺が発達した筒形の埴輪をいう。
sen.e: Ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa) are cylindrical haniwa developed from tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) and tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar) used in the burial rituals of a chief of Kibi region.
The cylindrical Haniwa are developed from ceremonial vessel stand and ceremonial jar used in the burial rituals of a chief of Kibi region.
sen.cmt: Ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa)→cylindrical Haniwaに修正しました。二つ目のcylindrical haniwa削除しました。tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand)、tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar)→ceremonial vessel stand、ceremonial jarに修正しました。
sen.e: The cylindrical Haniwa are developed from ceremonial vessel stand and ceremonial jar used in the burial rituals of a chief of Kibi region.

sen.j: 遅れて特殊器台に特殊壺を載せた形の朝顔型円筒埴輪がでてきた。
sen.e: Later, bell-shaped haniwa which have the form putting a tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar) on a tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) appeared.
Later, the bell-shaped Haniwa, which had the form putting a ceremonial jar on a ceremonial vessel stand appeared.
sen.cmt: theを追加しました。haniwa大文字に修正しました。haveを過去形に修正しました。tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand)、tokushu tsubo (ceremonial jar)→ceremonial vessel stand、ceremonial jarに修正しました。
sen.e: Later, the bell-shaped Haniwa, which had the form putting a ceremonial jar on a ceremonial vessel stand appeared.

sen.j: これらの埴輪は、古墳の各段や墳頂、造出しなどに列状に並べられ、畏怖的・視覚的な効果を狙ったものと考えられる。
sen.e: These haniwa were displayed in a line on each step of tumulus, on the mound top and narrow terrace, giving visual effect and awe.
These Haniwa were displayed in a line on each step of tumulus, on the mound top and the funeral ritual site of the tumulus, giving visual effect and awe.
sen.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました。narrow terrace→に修正しました。
sen.e: These Haniwa were displayed in a line on each step of tumulus, on the mound top and the funeral ritual site of the tumulus, giving visual effect and awe.

sen.j: 前方後円墳の出現期から終末まで配列されたので、古墳の年代決定に大きな役割を果たしている。
sen.e: They play great role in dating because they were aligned from the appearance of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound to its end.
They played a greater role in dating because they were arranged from the appearance of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound to its end.
sen.cmt: play過去形に修正しました。great role→a greater roleに修正しました。aligned修正しました。
sen.e: They played a greater role in dating because they were arranged from the appearance of large keyhole-shaped tomb mound to its end.

tit.e: Keisho haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast)
Keisho Haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast)
tit.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました
tit.e: Keisho Haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast)

sen.j: 形象埴輪は、円筒埴輪とは起源を異にすると推定されている。
sen.e: It is believed keisho haniwa (clay figure in the shape of human or beast) have different origin from ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa).
It is believed that Keisho Haniwa have different origin from cylindrical Haniwa.
sen.cmt: that追加しました。(clay figure in the shape of human or beast)既出なので削除しました。Ento haniwa (cylindrical haniwa)→cylindrical Haniwaに修正しました。
sen.e: It is believed that Keisho Haniwa have different origin from cylindrical Haniwa.

sen.j: 家形埴輪、器財埴輪、動物埴輪、人物埴輪に大きく分けることができる。
sen.e: They consist roughly of kakei haniwa (house-shaped clay figure), kizai haniwa (clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield), animal-shaped haniwa and a haniwa figure of a man.
They consist roughly of house-shaped Haniwa, Kizai Haniwa, animal-shaped Haniwa and Haniwa figure of men.
sen.cmt: Kakei Haniwa→house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。(clay figure in the shape of things such as sword or shield)既出なので削除しました。haniwa大文字に修正しました。a man→menに修正しました。
sen.e: They consist roughly of house-shaped Haniwa, Kizai Haniwa, animal-shaped Haniwa and Haniwa figure of men.

tit.cmt: Kakei Haniwa→house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。

sen.j: 古墳の頂上の中央に置かれる。
sen.e: They were placed on the center of the tumulus top.
They were placed on the center of the tumulus top.
They were placed on the center of the tumulus top.

sen.j: 一棟だけ置かれることは少ない。
sen.e: More than two of them were usually placed.
More than two of Kakei Haniwa were usually placed.
More than two of Kakei Haniwa were usually placed.

sen.j: 構造、規模などの異なる複数の家形埴輪を一面に、または列状に並べる。
sen.e: Various kakei haniwa (house-shaped clay figure) with different structure and size were displayed all over or in a line.
Various house-shaped Haniwa with different structure and size were displayed all over or in a line.
sen.cmt: Kakei Haniwa→house-shaped Haniwaに修正しました。
sen.e: Various house-shaped Haniwa with different structure and size were displayed all over or in a line.

tit.cmt: Theを削除しました。haniwa大文字に修正しました。

sen.j: 踊る埴輪（埼玉県熊谷市野原古墳出土）東京国立博物館所蔵
sen.e: Dancing haniwa (unearthed from Kumagaya City Saitama Prefecture Nohara Tumulus) possessed by Tokyo National Museum
Dancing Haniwa (unearthed from Nohara Tumulus, in Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture) possessed by Tokyo National Museum
sen.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました。地名の語順を修正しました。
sen.e: Dancing Haniwa (unearthed from Nohara Tumulus, in Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture) possessed by Tokyo National Museum

sen.j: 力士埴輪（和歌山県和歌山市井辺八幡山古墳同志社大学所蔵）
sen.e: Sumo wrestler haniwa (Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture Ibehatiman-yama Mountain Tumulus possessed by Doshisha University)
Sumo wrestler Haniwa (unearthed from Ibehatiman-yama Mountain Tumulus, in Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture, possessed by Doshisha University)
sen.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました。unearthed fromを追加しました。地名の語順を修正しました。
sen.e: Sumo wrestler Haniwa (unearthed from Ibehatiman-yama Mountain Tumulus, in Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture, possessed by Doshisha University)

sen.j: 武人埴輪
sen.e: Warrior haniwa
Warrior Haniwa
sen.cmt: haniwa大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: Warrior Haniwa

sen.j: 派生
sen.e: Derivation
Derivation
Derivation

sen.j: スカートの下にジャージをはいた格好を埴輪ルックと言う。
sen.e: The style wearing sweat suit under a skirt is called haniwa look.
The style wearing sweat suit under a skirt is called haniwa look.
The style wearing sweat suit under a skirt is called haniwa look.

sen.j: 女子中高生が冬によくやっている。
sen.e: Female junior and senior high school students often dress in such style in winter.
Junior and senior high school girls often dress in such style in winter.
sen.cmt: 文の最後に余分なスペースがあるので削除しました。Female junior and senior high school studentsを修正しました。
sen.e: Junior and senior high school girls often dress in such style in winter.
